Authors:
Thao Phuong Nguyen, Pham Hoang, Akira Suzuzki, Kiminori
SHIMIZU, Toshimitsu FUKIHARU, Elizabeth Sheedy
Title:
Coprinopsis neocinerea sp. nov., an agaric ammonia fungus
from Southern Vietnam
Keywords:
Coprinoid fungi, Lam Dong, saprotrophic, Subsect.
Lanatuli, urea.
Abstract:
Coprinopsis neocinerea sp. nov. (Basidiomycota,
Agaricales, Psathyrellaceae), collected from urea treated soil of
broadleaf mixed forest in Vietnam, is described as a new species of
ammonia fungus. Morphologically this species is similar to Coprinopsis
cinerea, but it differs in basidiospore shape. Phylogenetic analysis
with nuclear ribosomal internal transcribed spacer (ITS) data also
supports this new taxon. This is the first report of a saprotrophic
ammonia fungus in Vietnam.
